edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.layers

Class LayerInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.layers.LayerInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicLayerInfo

    public class LayerInfo
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Contains information about each layer in a map service. LayerInfo has no constructor.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

    • Method Detail

      • hasDefaultVisibility

        public final boolean hasDefaultVisibility()
        Default visibility of the layers in the map service.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setDefaultVisibility

        public final void setDefaultVisibility(boolean defaultVisibility)
        Set the defaultVisibility parameter.
        Parameters:
        defaultVisibility - - Default visibility of the layers in the map service.

      • getId

        public final int getId()
        Layer ID assigned by ArcGIS Server for a layer. The topmost layer is 0, and each layer follows sequentially. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.
        Returns:
        int

      • setId

        public final void setId(int id)
        Set the id
        Parameters:
        id - - Layer ID assigned by ArcGIS Server for a layer. The topmost layer is 0, and each layer follows sequentially. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.

      • getMaxScale

        public final double getMaxScale()
        The maximum visible scale for each layer in the map service. If the map is zoomed in beyond this scale the layer will not be visible. A value of 0 means that the layer does not have a maximum scale. This property is only available for map services published using ArcGIS Server 10 SP1 or later.
        Returns:
        float

      • setMaxScale

        public final void setMaxScale(double maxScale)
        Set the maxScale parameter.
        Parameters:
        maxScale - - The maximum visible scale for each layer in the map service. If the map is zoomed in beyond this scale the layer will not be visible. A value of 0 means that the layer does not have a maximum scale. This property is only available for map services published using ArcGIS Server 10 SP1 or later.

      • getMinScale

        public final double getMinScale()
        The maximum visible scale for each layer in the map service. If the map is zoomed in beyond this scale the layer will not be visible. A value of 0 means that the layer does not have a maximum scale. This property is only available for map services published using ArcGIS Server 10 SP1 or later.
        Returns:
        float

      • setMinScale

        public final void setMinScale(double minScale)
        Set the minScale parameter.
        Parameters:
        minScale - - The maximum visible scale for each layer in the map service. If the map is zoomed in beyond this scale the layer will not be visible. A value of 0 means that the layer does not have a maximum scale. This property is only available for map services published using ArcGIS Server 10 SP1 or later.

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Layer name as defined in the map service.
        Returns:
        String

      • setName

        public final void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - - Layer name as defined in the map service.

      • getParentLayerId

        public final int getParentLayerId()
        If the layer is part of a group layer, it will include the parent ID of the group layer. Otherwise, the value is -1. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.
        Returns:
        int

      • setParentLayerId

        public final void setParentLayerId(int parentLayerId)
        Set the parent layer id.
        Parameters:
        parentLayerId - - If the layer is part of a group layer, it will include the parent ID of the group layer. Otherwise, the value is -1. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.

      • getSubLayerIds

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger getSubLayerIds()
        If the layer is a parent layer, it will have one or more sublayers included in an array. Otherwise, the value is null. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.
        Returns:
        JsArrayInteger

      • setSubLayerIds

        public final void setSubLayerIds(int[] subLayerIds)
        Set the sublayer ids.
        Parameters:
        subLayerIds - - If the layer is a parent layer, it will have one or more sublayers included in an array. Otherwise, the value is null. If a layer is added or removed from the source map document, the ID values will shift accordingly.

      • hasLegendInfo

        public final boolean hasLegendInfo()
        Check to see if this LayerInfo has legend information attached.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getLegendInfo

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<LegendInfo> getLegendInfo()
        Get the layers LegendInfo if it is attached to this LayerInfo object.
        Returns:
        JsArray
